did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Alphbetical files of Assistant Director Hendrik Edelman concerning collection development.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Hendrik Edelman served as Assistant Director of the Cornell University Libraries from 1969 to 1979, and then became University Librarian at Rutgers University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Alphbetical files of Assistant Director Hendrik Edelman concerning collection development. Also, files relating to research on his book, Dutch-American Bibliography 1693-1794, a descriptive catalog of Dutch-language books, pamphlets, and almanacs printed in America, 1974; research, consulting, teaching, and other professional papers relating to immigrant presses in America and to library collection development; videos of a Pennsylvania State Library teleconference on collection development; and publications by Edelman.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Hendrik Edelman papers, #13-1-1887. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Includes notes, reprints, copies and "A Guide to the Archives of the Netherlands Museum,Holland, Michigan, 1978"

scopecontent.p: Includes Logos, Library Journal, the Book Publishing Annual, Christian Book Publishing and Distribution and publications on eighteenth century English books, library research, computing etc. Also includes articles and interviews by Edelman
Includes books on library planning, library search tools, library collection management, university libraries, library journals, computer innovation, obituaries etc.
